    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(Geom_element geometryOfElement,
              Meta_data dataOfElement,
              int ID)
        Constructor for the GIS_element object. gets a Geom_element, Meta_data and ID.
        Parameters:
        geometryOfElement - Geom_element, the geometry object of the element.
        dataOfElement - Meta_data, the data of the element.
        ID - Integer, the ID for the element.

      • Player

        public Player()
        empty constructor for the Player. Will set its speed to 20.0 , eat radius to 1, and an empty arraylist of targets.

      • Player

        public Player​(java.lang.String line)
        Constructor for the GIS_element object. gets a String. the string will be splitted and each argument will be sent to the right construction.
        Parameters:
        line - , The all data about this element.

    • Method Detail

      • getAngleToTarget

        public double getAngleToTarget​(GIS_element target)
        Given a gis_element_obj as target, this method will return the angle from the player position to this target.
        Parameters:
        target - gis_element_obj, such as fruit,packmen, etc.
        Returns:
        the angle, in degrees (Double), to the target.

      • moveToEatTarget

        public void moveToEatTarget​(GIS_element target,
                            GIS_layer ghosts)
        This function will get a target and moves to target location until target is eaten, while avoiding ghosts on the way.
        Parameters:
        target - gis_element_obj, such as a fruit or packmen, etc.
        ghosts - GIS_layer, a set containing all ghosts (enemies) to avoid while moving to a target.

      • moveToAllTargets

        public void moveToAllTargets​(GIS_layer ghosts)
        This method will get a set of Ghosts, and moves the player to all current available targets, one by one. if, for any reason, a target becomes unavailable(such as a fruit is eaten by another packmen) while the player is on the way to the fruits, it will move to the next target in it's arraylist of targets. All this while avoiding ghosts on its way.
        Parameters:
        ghosts - GIS_layer, the Set of ghosts to avoid.

      • distancePointFromEatRadius

        public double distancePointFromEatRadius​(Point3D p)
        This method calculate distance point from radius of packman
        Parameters:
        p - - point to check distance to
        Returns:
        the distance between the Radius of packman to Point p.

      • updateGeom

        public void updateGeom​(java.lang.String firstBoardLine)
        This method will get a String representing all data about the new Object, but will only update the Geom of the Player, i.e its Point3D position.
        Parameters:
        firstBoardLine - String, the data about this packman needed to be parsed in order to update the Geom.

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget​(GIS_element target)
        This method will get a GIS_element target and add it to the player's arrayList of targets.
        Parameters:
        target - GIS_element, an object to add into the ArrayList of targets for this player.

      • setTargetsOrder

        public void setTargetsOrder​(java.util.ArrayList<GIS_element> targets)
        This method will get an ArrayList of GIS_elements (targets) and sets the ArrayList of targets for the player to this given ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        targets - ArrayList of GIS_elements, to set as targets for this player.

      • addTargetsList

        public void addTargetsList​(java.util.ArrayList<GIS_element> targets)
        This method will get an ArrayList of GIS_elements (targets) and adds all elements into the current ArrayList of targets for this player.
        Parameters:
        targets - ArrayList of GIS_elements, to add to the current ArrayList of targets.

      • removeTarget

        public void removeTarget​(GIS_element target)
        This method will get an GIS_element (target) and removes it from the ArrayList of targets for this player.

        target -
